titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jacques Denyse estate administration document 1977.076
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-09-20 21:35:01 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: One document, dated April 12, 1796, that appoints Adam Denyse and John Denyse as administrators of the estate of Jacques Denyse.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Jacques Denyse estate administration document, 1977.076, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The document was formally accessioned in 1977.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One document, dated April 12, 1796, that appoints Adam Denyse and John Denyse as administrators of the estate of Jacques Denyse. It is signed by Jacobus Lefferts, Surrogate of Kings County.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Jacques Denyse was a resident of the town of Gravesend, which later became the Brooklyn neighborhood of Gravesend.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain.
